80601011.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ed354d>Legendary</color> Resonator Type-II Sticker at random.

80601012.Name: Resonator Type-III Sticker Blind Box
80601012.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ed354d>Legendary</color> Resonator Type-III Sticker at random.

80601013.Name: Resonator Type-I Sticker Blind Box
80601013.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ca6dff>Unique</color> Resonator Type-I Sticker at random.

40040006.Name: Tape of Last Words
40040006.Desc: Touch to collect or use Grapple to hook and quickly approach the Tapes of Last Words scattered across Lahai-Roi.
40040006.Bg:
When the Void Storm consumes personnel carrying a Cassette, the magnetic moment within the device becomes corrupted, reducing it to a Tape of Last Words. The encoded information is rendered unreadable.
A Mechasout in a Solsworn apparel is now collecting these Tapes of Last Words in the hope of "cleansing" the Voidmatter corruption and restoring the data once preserved within them.

40040007.Name: Soliseed of Essehalo
40040007.Desc: Obtained by finding a lost Soliskin. Deliver it to the Giant Soliskin at the Monument of Returning Soliseeds to claim your reward.
40040007.Bg: Like plants, the Essehalo floating above the Soliskin grows and bears fruits, which are carefully preserved and later given to those who earn the Soliskin's trust.

80110442.Name: Lingering Summer Light
80110442.Desc: Background music played while looking down at the lights in Honami on top of Neon Tower.
80110442.Bg: Unlocked after completing Main Quest "Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands."

80110443.Name: Tangled Flower
80110443.Bg: Unlocked after completing Main Quest "Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands."

80110444.Name: Towards the End
80110444.Desc: Background played when battling the Elegy of the Fallen.
80110444.Bg: Unlocked after completing Main Quest "Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands."

80110445.Name: Before the Cicadas Fade
80110445.Desc: Background music in the unrenovated Shashou Cafe.
80110445.Bg: Unlocked after completing Main Quest "Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands."

80110446.Name: Collapsing Dawn
80110446.Desc: Background music played when falling into Honami City.
80110446.Bg: Unlocked after completing Main Quest "Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands."

80110447.Name: Unfolding Chaos
80110447.Bg: Unlocked after completing Main Quest "Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands."

80110448.Name: When You Hold the Truth
80110448.Desc: Background music played when bidding farewell to Sumika.
80110448.Bg: Unlocked after completing Main Quest "Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands."

43021011.Name: Broken Wing Polarizer
43021011.Desc: A basic material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Sword Resonators.
43021011.Bg: A metallic shard, resembling a solitary butterfly wing, its surface dull and covered with a dense passivation layer. Under suitable temperature conditions, the residual frequency energy within can still be harnessed.

43021012.Name: Monowing Polarizer
43021012.Desc: A medium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Sword Resonators.
43021012.Bg: A metallic shard, resembling a pair of butterfly wings, its surface glimmers like Tacetites. Due to its reactive nature, careful storage is required after collection to prevent loss of its frequency energy.

43021013.Name: Polywing Polarizer
43021013.Desc: An advanced material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Sword Resonators.
43021013.Bg: A triple-winged metallic shard, exhibiting an unusual radiance. This material forms under extremely rare conditions, and its transformation patterns remain largely unexplored by current scientific research.

43021014.Name: Layered Wing Polarizer
43021014.Desc: A premium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Sword Resonators.
43021014.Bg: A solidified metallic shard, resembling a fused cluster of butterfly wings. Microscopic analysis of a few samples reveals their highly intricate internal structure, which appears more like that of a living organism than an inorganic material.

43021021.Name: Incomplete Combustor
43021021.Desc: A basic material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Pistols Resonators.
43021021.Bg: A bullet-shaped metal, named Combustor for its peculiar shape. Specialized purification processes are required as it typically contains a high level of impurities.

43021022.Name: Aftertune Combustor
43021022.Desc: A medium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Pistols Resonators.
43021022.Bg: Resembling a solidified bullet, this metal has undergone quenching, greatly reducing impurities. Even non-specialists can discern the differences between various grades.

43021023.Name: Remnant Combustor
43021023.Desc: An advanced material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Pistols Resonators.
43021023.Bg: Resembling a bullet, this metal has its impurities almost removed after repeated purification. Beyond its practical applications, its exquisite and unusual form makes it a highly sought-after collectible.

43021024.Name: Reverb Combustor
43021024.Desc: A premium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Pistols Resonators.
43021024.Bg: Rsembling a bullet, this metal is virtually flawless in purity. Some Resonators hesitate to use it as Ascension Material, preferring to have it crafted into unique ornaments by skilled artisans.

43021031.Name: Spliced String
43021031.Desc: A basic material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Rectifier Resonators.
43021031.Bg: Pieced together from fragments, this Resonance Cord reveals to humans the concept of stationary vibration for the first time.

43021032.Name: Broken String
43021032.Desc: A medium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Rectifier Resonators.
43021032.Bg: Intermittent and incomplete, this Resonance Cord contains stored tonal energy that can be extracted by researchers, yet its content remains indecipherable.

43021033.Name: Solidified String
43021033.Desc: An advanced material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Rectifier Resonators.
43021033.Bg: Complete and solidified, this Resonance Cord captures the paradox of motion and stillness that fascinates researchers. Its secrets, however, remain unsolved.

43021034.Name: Melodic String
43021034.Desc: A premium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Rectifier Resonators.
43021034.Bg: Interwoven yet balanced, this Resonance Cord is as harmonious as a song that no one has ever written. Perhaps it is more a subject for aesthetics than science.

43021041.Name: LF Carved Crystal
43021041.Desc: A basic material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Broadblade Resonators.
43021041.Bg: A chipped crystal of Waveworn residue. Originally a blocky structure, its equilibrium is broken, and its Remnant Energy has mostly dissipated.

43021042.Name: MF Carved Crystal
43021042.Desc: A medium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Broadblade Resonators.
43021042.Bg: A chipped crystal of Waveworn residue. It remains stable and, with the proper absorber, the contained Remnant Energy may still be extracted.

43021043.Name: HF Carved Crystal
43021043.Desc: An advanced material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Broadblade Resonators.
43021043.Bg: A chipped crystal of Waveworn residue. It maintains a delicate equilibrium and, after centrifugation, its concentrated product becomes widely useful.

43021044.Name: FF Carved Crystal
43021044.Desc: A premium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Broadblade Resonators.
43021044.Bg: A chipped crystal of Waveworn residue. It maintains a breathtakingly stable equilibrium. As a critical material for advanced technologies, it is subject to the strictest trade restrictions worldwide.

43021051.Name: LF Waveworn Shard
43021051.Desc: A basic material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Gauntlets Resonators.
43021051.Bg: A radial-cracked Waveworn residue. Its equilibrium has been disrupted, and the remaining Remnant Energy has decayed to mere Reverberations.

43021052.Name: MF Waveworn Shard
43021052.Desc: A medium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Gauntlets Resonators.
43021052.Bg: A radial-cracked Waveworn residue. It remains stable and, with the proper absorber, the contained Remnant Energy may still be extracted.

43021053.Name: HF Waveworn Shard
43021053.Desc: An advanced material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Gauntlets Resonators.
43021053.Bg: A radial-cracked Waveworn residue. It maintains a delicate equilibrium and, after centrifugation, its concentrated product becomes widely useful.

43021054.Name: FF Waveworn Shard
43021054.Desc: A premium material used for Weapon Ascension and Skill Upgrade for Gauntlets Resonators.
43021054.Bg: A radial-cracked Waveworn residue. It maintains a breathtakingly stable equilibrium. As a critical material for advanced technologies, it is subject to the strictest trade restrictions worldwide.

63.Name: Synchro Coin
63.Desc:
A special token issued by the Synchrolink System based on the trainee's performance in general simulation training.
Each hard-earned coin stands as proof of a Synchronist's progress and breakthroughs. Can be exchanged for a variety of supplies that the Academy prepared for Synchronists.

41400264.Name: Suncoveter's Reach
41400264.Desc: Starward Handmaiden: Hyvatia's drop, used for Resonator Ascension.
41400264.Bg:
Fragment of the Hyvatia Observation Array's Primary Lens
Once used to survey the Reactor Drive, Hyvatia was among the Spacetrek Collective's proudest creations. Now, the polished beryllium plate no longer reflects the sun of tomorrow, but a distorted illusion of Voidmatter. What stretches toward the future is no longer noble ideals, but grasping, covetous hands.

41400274.Name: Burning Judgment
41400274.Desc: Reactor Husk's drop, used for Resonator Ascension.
41400274.Bg:
When the Reactor Drive's defense is triggered, it can only mean that the Threnodian has breached containment. The mech will eliminate the intruder at all costs. 
Even if the body itself is destroyed, it will fulfill its duty to the very last moment.

42601320.Name: Pine Cone
42601320.Bg: These pinecones grow slowly under low clusters of needles. Their thick shells can't hide the warm, nutty scent inside. The kernels have a gentle pine-resin sweetness, and once roasted, they release a mellow, toasty aroma, perfect for travelers crossing the frostlands who need quick energy.

42601340.Name: Dusk Honeypot
42601340.Bg:
A large berry nourished by the Reactor Drive's light, gleaming with the warm amber glow of dusk. Sweet-tart, juicy, and rich in natural sugars, it is often gathered by Shepherds tending the Exoswarm, who drink its nectar to recover their strength.

Yet once a Dusk Honeypot overripens, it can leave both humans and Exoswarm intoxicated. When a Shepherd fails to return from a foraging trip, chances are they've simply indulged in one too many overripe berries without realizing it.

42601350.Name: Fern Spore
42601350.Bg:
An ancient fern that thrives in cool, shady spots. Its newly sprouted fronds will curl tightly at the tips, forming tender, fresh fern balls. Naturally dehydrated after being picked, these balls are easy to preserve as compact, long-lasting dried food.

Before eating, simply soak them in snowmelt to rehydrate, and they instantly regain a vibrant, fresh green, as if just harvested. The Roya often thread Fern Spores for grilling or scatter them in shaded areas to grow new ferns. Most Roya have their first taste of Fern Spores in early childhood, though it's rarely a fond memory.

42601360.Name: Cradle Lichen
42601360.Bg:
This species of lichen clings to waterside rocks, its existence as ancient as the underground cavern itself, even predating the arrival of the Exostrider. Long before the underground was called Lahai-Roi, this type of lichen had already taken root. Over countless years, it slowly eroded the hard rock, breaking it down into soil capable of nurturing new life.

In Royan mythology, Cradle Lichen symbolizes return and transformation. When burying precious objects, the Roya will weave the lichen into mats, wrapping the treasures before laying them in the earth.

42601370.Name: Jade Wood
42601370.Desc: A material used for Weapon and Tool crafting.
42601370.Bg:
After the geological shifts in the Royan Frostlands, some trees were frozen instantly, while others were dragged underground with the moving crust and slowly turned into minerals under long pressure. Their growth rings remain perfectly preserved, providing key clues about how Solaris's climate changed after the Lament.

In Royan stories, Jade Wood stands for time, experience, and wisdom—the embodiment of nature's memories.

42601380.Name: Gemini Spore
42601380.Desc: A material used for Resonator Ascension.
42601380.Bg:
A meteorite crashes into the ground, and upon it sprout spores. The fungal network grows, forming a microscopic cosmos of its own.

The Gemini Spores are extraordinarily delicate. One gentle puff and they dissolve into fine spore dust, drifting like a miniature galaxy. Yet they are also incredibly resilient, perhaps harboring faint frequencies of the "old universe." They are the only Lahai-Roi creature capable of surviving in the Voidmatter Zone.

The frequencies of the star clusters have painted them with celestial colors. The Roya use these spores as pigments to record observed galaxies or create predictive petroglyphs of their structures.

42601390.Name: Rimewisp
42601390.Desc: A material used for Resonator Ascension.
42601390.Bg: No taller than the knee, fragile against the icy wind, yet it grows year after year in the cracks of frozen rocks. Only at the very instant the polar night ends does it bloom, unfurling clusters of white flowers like delicate snowflakes. The Roya call it Linnaea, meaning "the last trace of tenderness in the blizzard."

42601400.Name: Arithmetic Shell
42601400.Desc: A material used for Resonator Ascension.
42601400.Bg: For most Roya, their first encounter with "calculation" in childhood wasn't a numeration table from Startorch Academy, but the cross-section of an ancient seashell. These fossilized shells, known as Arithmetic Shells, have natural interiors etched into concentric grooves, like a mathematical grid carved by the hands of the divine. Elders would teach children to drop small stones of varying colors and shapes—or tiny sticks—into the grooves, mimicking the processes of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, distribution, and pairing…

80004004.Name: The Frosted Hope in Our Stars
80004004.Desc: An item serving as access to the Birthday Celebration. Used to review blessings sent by your companions.
80004004.Bg:
Cream, icing, chiffon cake... every ingredient handpicked by your friends to bake this little "sweet dream," all for the sake of your gentle smile as you make your wish.
Take a bite, and you'll taste soft, warm memories: the days you shared, the hopes left unspoken, all blending into the cake's comforting aroma.

80004005.Name: Trails of Companion Stars
80004005.Desc: A customized 2026 birthday accessory for Rover. This circlet braided from starlight and Resonance Cord now rests in your Backpack, as if it had always been there.
80004005.Bg: The stars and voices that travel with you are gathered within this circlet-shaped device, their energy preserved and always flowing around you. Both functional and decorative, it stands for praise, honor, and the heartfelt wish from your friends: "May your path ahead be wrapped in light and hope."

80004006.Name: A Promised Moment
80004006.Desc: The 2026 birthday song, specially readapted by your dear friends.
80004006.Bg:
A piece of music as gentle and bright as the afternoon breeze that once brushed your cheek. It carries shared memories of adventures, unspoken gratitude, and quiet longing. With every note, the happy days you lived through return once more. This isn't merely a song written for you. It's a moment in time, carefully kept for you.
Happy birthday, Rover.

64.Name: Antivoid Modding Point
64.Desc: A digital permit granted upon the completion of Modding Tasks. Used to install functional modules on an expedition motorbike.
64.Bg: "A full-on skill-point upgrade system, straight out of the classic RPGs! Now that's what we're talking about!"

70290000.Name: New Student ID
70290000.Desc: A new student ID of Startorch Academy.
70290000.Bg: A brand-new student ID issued upon your admission, symbolizing your identity as an official member of Startorch Academy. Though its design has changed with new patterns, the people and moments from your past remain unchanged, waiting patiently for your return.

41100061.Name: LF Exoswarm Core
41100061.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100061.Bg: Fragile flower-shaped Tacet Core, resembling a dying blossom. Commonly found in areas affected by Void Storms.

41100062.Name: MF Exoswarm Core
41100062.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100062.Bg: Standard flower-shaped Tacet Core, resembling a wilting blossom. Often recovered from Exoswarm corrupted by Void Storms.

41100063.Name: HF Exoswarm Core
41100063.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100063.Bg: Stable flower-shaped Tacet Core, resembling a budding blossom. Occasionally found in areas with frequent Void Storm occurrences.

41100064.Name: FF Exoswarm Core
41100064.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100064.Bg: Unique flower-shaped Tacet Core, resembling a fully bloomed blossom. Found only in the most dangerous areas ravaged by Void Storms. Legend has it that when a Void Storm sweeps across Lahai-Roi, this kind of Tacet Core may be seen entwined around the body of the strongest Exoswarm.

41100071.Name: LF Mech Core
41100071.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100071.Bg: Fragile triangle Tacet Cord, looking broken and unstable. Commonly found in areas affected by Void Storms.

41100072.Name: MF Mech Core
41100072.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100072.Bg: Standard triangle Tacet Cord, on the brink of shattering. Commonly found in areas ravaged by Void Storms.

41100073.Name: HF Mech Core
41100073.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100073.Bg: Stable triangle Tacet Cord, with a strong, enduring structure. Occasionally found in areas with frequent Void Storm occurrences.

41100074.Name: FF Mech Core
41100074.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100074.Bg: Special triangle Tacet Cord, exhibiting the most resilient structure, retaining complete frequency even under intense energy shock. Legend has it that when a Void Storm sweeps across Lahai-Roi, this kind of Tacet Cord can control even the most powerful mech humanity has ever built.

41100081.Name: Fractured Exoswarm Pendant
41100081.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100081.Bg: A broken pendant. It was a traditional Royan accessory used by the Roya to bind scattered Exoswarm components together, symbolizing connection. Among the Royan Outcasts, however, the Exoswarm are seen not as companions but as prey. They hunt the Exoswarm and take the pendants from other Roya as trophies of their victories.

41100082.Name: Worn Exoswarm Pendant
41100082.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100082.Bg: A worn pendant. It was a traditional Royan accessory used by the Roya to bind scattered Exoswarm components together, symbolizing connection. Among the Royan Outcasts, however, the Exoswarm are seen not as companions but as prey. They hunt the Exoswarm and take the pendants from other Roya as trophies of their victories.

41100083.Name: Chipped Exoswarm Pendant
41100083.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100083.Bg: A slightly worn pendant. It was a traditional Royan accessory used by the Roya to bind scattered Exoswarm components together, symbolizing connection. Among the Royan Outcasts, however, the Exoswarm are seen not as companions but as prey. They hunt the Exoswarm and take the pendants from other Roya as trophies of their victories.

41100084.Name: Intact Exoswarm Pendant
41100084.Desc: A material used for Weapon & Resonator Ascension and Skill Upgrade.
41100084.Bg: A relatively intact pendant. It was a traditional Royan accessory used by the Roya to bind scattered Exoswarm components together, symbolizing connection. Among the Royan Outcasts, however, the Exoswarm are seen not as companions but as prey. They hunt the Exoswarm and take the pendants from other Roya as trophies of their victories.

50000121.Name: Originite Weapon Supply Chest
50000121.Desc:
Open to claim one Originite series weapon of your choice:
<color=Rare4>Broadblade#41 *1</color>
<color=Rare4>Sword#18 *1</color>
<color=Rare4>Pistols#26 *1</color>
<color=Rare4>Gauntlets#21D *1</color>
<color=Rare4>Rectifier#25 *1</color>
50000121.Bg: The special supply chest obtained from Shilang in the Tiger's Maw.

50000122.Name: Originite Weapon Supply Chest
50000122.Desc:
Open to claim one Originite series weapon of your choice:
<color=Rare4>Broadblade#41 *1</color>
<color=Rare4>Sword#18 *1</color>
<color=Rare4>Pistols#26 *1</color>
<color=Rare4>Gauntlets#21D *1</color>
<color=Rare4>Rectifier#25 *1</color>
50000122.Bg: The special supply chest obtained from Shilang in the Tiger's Maw.

80601014.Name: Universal Sticker Pack
80601014.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ed354d>Legendary</color> Universal Sticker at random.

80601015.Name: Universal Sticker Pack
80601015.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ffe65a>Collection</color> Universal Sticker at random.

80601016.Name: Resonator Type-II Sticker Blind Box
80601016.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ca6dff>Unique</color> Resonator Type-II Sticker at random.

80601017.Name: Universal Sticker Pack
80601017.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ca6dff>Unique</color> Universal Sticker at random.

80601018.Name: Resonator Type-I Sticker Blind Box
80601018.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ffe65a>Collection</color> Resonator Type-I Sticker at random.

80601019.Name: Resonator Type-II Sticker Blind Box
80601019.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ffe65a>Collection</color> Resonator Type-II Sticker at random.

80601020.Name: Resonator Type-III Sticker Blind Box
80601020.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ffe65a>Collection</color> Resonator Type-III Sticker at random.

80601021.Name: Resonator Type-I Sticker Blind Box
80601021.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ed354d>Legendary</color> Resonator Type-I Sticker at random.

80601022.Name: Resonator Type-II Sticker Blind Box
80601022.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ed354d>Legendary</color> Resonator Type-II Sticker at random.

80601023.Name: Resonator Type-III Sticker Blind Box
80601023.Desc: Open to get 1 <color=#ed354d>Legendary</color> Resonator Type-III Sticker at random.

42601410.Name: Luxite
42601410.Bg:
Due to the Exostrider's fragmented frequencies incorporated into these minerals, they have become ideal materials for both Exoswarm restoration and construction. Over the course of history, the Exoswarm has been instinctively collecting Luxite. Some friendly Exoswarm also assist the Spacetrek Collective in harvesting the mineral, providing material for Lahai-Roi's infrastructure.

Beyond its practical uses, certain Luxite deposits possess exceptional optical properties. At specific angles, they refract the Reactor's light in a fixed pattern, allowing observers to determine their position relative to the Reactor Drive. The Roya call these special stones the Eye of Sol.

80131003.Name: Calamity Ender
80131003.Desc: Obtained after completing all challenges in Tactical Hologram: Calamity.
80131003.Bg: A testament to conquering countless foes within the simulation. What fails to kill you only makes you stronger.

80131004.Name: Bathed in Pain
80131004.Desc: Obtained after completing all challenges in Tactical Hologram: Phantom Pain.
80131004.Bg: Pain spun from innumerable illusions becomes the whetstone that tempers your blade.

80130053.Name: Colorful Dawn
80130053.Desc: Colors at her fingertips, wind in her ears, and the future in her gaze—her motorbike streaks a bright trail as she rides toward a dawning horizon.

80130054.Name: Anchor of Ideals
80130054.Desc: Observe. Calculate. Calibrate. Extrapolate… And in the end, she reaches toward the stars.

50010004.Name: Morphable Echo - Rite of Gilded Revelation
50010004.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Rite of Gilded Revelation

2pcs Set: Spectro DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Dealing Basic Attack DMG increases Spectro DMG by 10% for 5s, stacking up to 3 times. With 3 stacks, casting Resonance Liberation grants 40% Basic Attack DMG Bonus.
50010004.Bg: Through the cracks, deep rumbles of distant waves sound...

50010005.Name: Morphable Echo - Halo of Starry Radiance
50010005.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Halo of Starry Radiance.

2pcs Set: Healing Bonus+10%.

5pcs Set: When healing a Resonator in the team, every 1% of Off-Tune Buildup Rate grants a 0.2% ATK increase to all Resonators in the team for 4s, up to 25%. Effects of the same name cannot be stacked.
50010005.Bg: Through the cracks, deep rumbles of distant waves sound...

50010006.Name: Morphable Echo - Pact of Neonlight Leap
50010006.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Pact of Neonlight Leap.

2pcs Set: Spectro DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Casting Outro Skill increases the ATK of the incoming Resonator who casts Intro Skill by 15%. Each point of Tune Break Boost the incoming Resonator has additionally increases their ATK by 0.3%, up to 15%. This effect lasts for 15s, or until the Resonator is switched out.
50010006.Bg: Through the cracks, deep rumbles of distant waves sound...

50020004.Name: Morphable Echo - Rite of Gilded Revelation
50020004.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Rite of Gilded Revelation

2pcs Set: Spectro DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Dealing Basic Attack DMG increases Spectro DMG by 10% for 5s, stacking up to 3 times. With 3 stacks, casting Resonance Liberation grants 40% Basic Attack DMG Bonus.
50020004.Bg: Through the cracks, deep rumbles of distant waves sound...

50020005.Name: Morphable Echo - Halo of Starry Radiance
50020005.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Halo of Starry Radiance.

2pcs Set: Healing Bonus+10%.

5pcs Set: When healing a Resonator in the team, every 1% of Off-Tune Buildup Rate grants a 0.2% ATK increase to all Resonators in the team for 4s, up to 25%. Effects of the same name cannot be stacked.
50020005.Bg: Through the cracks, deep rumbles of distant waves sound...

50020006.Name: Morphable Echo - Pact of Neonlight Leap
50020006.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Pact of Neonlight Leap.

2pcs Set: Spectro DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Casting Outro Skill increases the ATK of the incoming Resonator who casts Intro Skill by 15%. Each point of Tune Break Boost the incoming Resonator has additionally increases their ATK by 0.3%, up to 15%. This effect lasts for 15s, or until the Resonator is switched out.
50020006.Bg: Through the cracks, deep rumbles of distant waves sound...

72010100.Name: Dhalifa's Forte Evaluation Report
72010100.Bg: During Dhalifa's pre-admission physical, researchers questioned her Resonance abilities, especially how she alone survived a Void Storm. The incident drew no small amount of attention at the time, but in the end, everyone agreed it was only a miracle no one could replicate.

72010101.Name: Dhalifa's Cherished Item
72010101.Bg: Dhalifa's childhood, the first chapter of her story.

72010102.Name: Silk with Names
72010102.Bg: On the day Dhalifa was discharged, Sephira could not hold back her tears. Holding this length of silk, she crossed out Dhalifa's name right before her eyes.

72010103.Name: The Genesis of the Twin Nova Project: A Developmental Retrospective (Excerpt)
72010103.Bg: At the Institute, discussions about the Twin Nova series combat mechs never seem to die down. Their development and their elegant combat maneuvers remain a favorite topic among researchers.

72010104.Name: The Genesis of the Spacetrek Explorer Project: A Developmental Retrospective (Excerpt)
72010104.Bg: Massive wheels, an intimidating cannon, and blistering speed. Students passionate about motorbike racing love challenging the Spacetrek Explorer, but every match is, without exception, terminated by S.I.G.M.A. before the engines even start.

72010105.Name: Route Constructor Operation Manual
72010105.Bg: When the first Route Constructor rolled off the production line, every researcher unanimously acknowledged that its creation was a major milestone in Lahai-Roi's scientific expeditions.

72010106.Name: Relay Station Rental Service Notice
72010106.Bg: Relay Stations serve as hubs in Lahai-Roi's route network. They bustle with traffic and supply deliveries, making them hotspots where rumors and intel flow.

72010107.Name: Rakosan's Speech (Excerpt)
72010107.Bg: Passion alone cannot sustain an undertaking of this scale. When Rakosan delivered his speech, every department head was present, a clear indicator of how meticulously he had laid the groundwork.

72010108.Name: Who Are the "Outcasts" (Excerpt)
72010108.Bg: Don't let the Outcasts' rough speech and brash manners fool you into thinking they are all brawn and no brains. Roya are, after all, Roya. Their intellect is not to be underestimated, even if they sometimes put it to dubious use.

66.Name: "Module"
66.Desc: Special drops from the Lahai-Roi region, which can be used to exchange for various items from I.R.I.S. at the Spacetrek Archive.
66.Bg:
The Spacetrek Collective has deployed Supply Chests across Lahai-Roi, serving not only as supply containers but also as terminals recording environmental data. 
These Supply Chests continuously record surrounding data, including temperature, humidity, frequency fluctuations, and the Voidmatter Index, storing it onto a disk known as the Module.
The information contained within the Modules can be revisited and analyzed, and they also serve as training data for I.R.I.S., nourishing her deep learning capabilities and enhancing her processing power.

50021.Name: Connoisseur Key
50021.Desc:
Unlocks the Insider Channel of the Pioneer Podcast and get additional privilege rewards.

Complete the Podcast Tasks for various rewards.
50021.Bg:
Special Deluxe Keycode for the Pioneer Podcast's Connoisseur Channel.
"Start listening to the Pioneer Podcast now to gain valuable insights for your outdoor adventures!"

10001509.Name: Lynae's Waveband
10001509.Desc: Can be used to activate Lynae's Resonance Chain.
10001509.Bg: A Resonator's Forte is composed of countless Wavebands. When these Wavebands form a complete Resonance Chain, the Resonator can unleash their full power.

10001209.Name: Mornye's Waveband
10001209.Desc: Can be used to activate Mornye's Resonance Chain.
10001209.Bg: A Resonator's Forte is composed of countless Wavebands. When these Wavebands form a complete Resonance Chain, the Resonator can unleash their full power.

80800001.Name: Trust Key
80800001.Desc: A symbol of a trusted bond forged with H.E.R.M.E.S. Used to unlock and upgrade various clearance levels in the rider training.
80800001.Bg: A data entity formed when H.E.R.M.E.S. grants you access to its underlying data port. You can even sense a faint warmth. Though born from pure logical computation, it feels like the prototype of a genuine heart.

67.Name: Exploration Data
67.Desc: Exploration Data collected from research expeditions in Lahai-Roi. Used to upgrade Lahai-Roi Pioneer Level.
67.Bg: What can be observed can be sensed, and what can be sensed can be understood.

54002.Name: Custom Livery: Farewell to Yesterday
54002.Desc: Used to unlock the corresponding Echo Aspect set.
54002.Bg:
Once bound by thorns, these wings now break free, soaring into the boundless sea of clouds.
The old laws no longer hold sway, for they will carry you to the farthest skies of freedom.

80700005.Name: Purified Mechanite
80700005.Desc: A Mechanite free of impurities, produced only after multiple rounds of highly complex refinement procedures.
80700005.Bg: Specialized material for the older Route Constructor model.

80700006.Name: Refined Compressed Bedrock
80700006.Desc: A product obtained by further compressing multiple Compressed Bedrocks, a process that consumes an immense amount of energy.
80700006.Bg: Specialized material for the older Route Constructor model.

80700007.Name: Boosted Constructor Core
80700007.Desc: A Constructor Core operating near overload, posing serious safety risks.
80700007.Bg: Specialized material for the older Route Constructor model.

70290001.Name: Admission Letter
70290001.Desc: An admission letter to Startorch Academy in Lahai-Roi, which also serves as an important passport within Lahai-Roi.
70290001.Bg:
An admission letter personally prepared by the Shorekeeper, bearing a permanent authorization.
On it is written: "Synchronist Test passed. Rabelle's Curve fitted. Exostrider adaptability confirmed."

70290002.Name: Frequency Cassette Recorder
70290002.Desc: A standardized Terminal for the Spacetrek Collective members. Your Rabelle Cassette is stored within.
70290002.Bg: Voices from the past are now overlaid by new memories. As the tape turns, past and future wind into a single reel.

70290003.Name: Trail of Sunshine
70290003.Desc: A livery gifted by Lynae for your expedition motorbike, in remembrance of your encounter and the battles you weathered together.
70290003.Bg: Carried by the winds of Lahai-Roi, she no longer fears the shadow of her past and now paints her colors freely.

10819.Name: Casket Sonar Use Permit: Roya Frostlands
10819.Desc: Grants the bearer of this permit the access to Casket Sonar in the given regions.
10819.Bg: The use permit of the Casket Sonar in Roya Frostlands. To ensure frequency safety in Roya Frostlands, users are permitted to use the Casket Sonar only within authorized areas in compliance with this official permit.

10820.Name: Lootmapper Use Permit: Roya Frostlands
10820.Desc: Grants the bearer of this permit the access to the Lootmapper in the given regions.
10820.Bg: The use permit of the Lootmapper in Roya Frostlands. To ensure frequency safety in Roya Frostlands, users are permitted to use the Lootmapper only within authorized areas in compliance with this official permit.

80000068.Name: Skelecanth Tartare
80000068.Desc: Reduces Wall Dash and Swimming STA consumption for all Resonators in the team by 20% for 15m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000068.Bg: In the Royan language, the name of this dish means "sand-buried"—a reference to how the Roya preserve Skelecanth rinsed in salt and spice. During this slow process, the fish gently ferments, its flesh turning tender and deeply flavorful.

80000069.Name: Lichen Salad
80000069.Desc: Increases Max HP of all Resonators in the team by 25% for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000069.Bg: In Lahai-Roi, every edible ingredient is treasured, even the humble Cradle Lichen. A handful of fresh, lightly seasoned lichen mixed with the nuts of Creeping Torchpine creates a simple yet nourishing Royan delicacy rich in dietary fiber.

80000070.Name: Pine Needle Soda
80000070.Bg: In the clear container, bubbles fizz upward, rising through the pine needles that drift and settle inside the glass. What began as a simple "use-what-you-have" nutritional drink turned out to be unexpectedly delicious. One sip, and the pine's fragrance lingers between your teeth. Crisp, aromatic, with a cooling sweetness that sweeps away every trace of fatigue.

80000071.Name: Honeypot Jam
80000071.Desc: Grants 25% Healing Bonus to all Resonators in the team for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000071.Bg: To make preserved Dusk Honeypot, the fully ripened berries are harvested and gently simmered to remove excess moisture, then finished with just a touch of sugar. Time stops within the jar. The berry loses its faint, intoxicating effect, but its sweetness remains, safely kept for an entire year.

80000072.Name: Smoked Meat Stew
80000072.Desc: Grants 40% Resonance Liberation DMG Bonus to all Resonators in the team for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000072.Bg: Thin slices of meat smoked over Creeping Torchpine needles are stewed together with the fermented drink, then served with mashed potatoes and a spoonful of Honeypot Jam. The rich fat of the Kronapuff mingles with the firm, chewy Lemming meat, offering alternating waves of flavor. On a night when the cold wind cuts to the bone, one mouthful of this dish is enough to make you forget the coldness and the exhaustion.

80000073.Name: Grilled Fern Spore
80000073.Desc: Increases Crit. DMG of all Resonators in the team by 32% for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000073.Bg: Young fern balls are picked, skewered, and grilled into one of the most common Royan greens. They have a noticeable bitterness. Fans say the aftertaste is pleasantly sweet, calling it "the taste of adulthood." Royan children avoid them, but anyone who can finish a whole skewer without making a face earns bragging rights.

80000074.Name: Fruit Crackle
80000074.Desc: Grants 30% Heavy Attack DMG Bonus to all Resonators in the team for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000074.Bg: A snack made from Dusk Honeypots coated in frozen syrup. It gets its name from the cracking sound you hear when you bite into it. It's a favorite among Royan children, though it takes some skill to crunch the sugar-coated berry without spilling its juice onto the clothes.

80000075.Name: "Crack & Bolt" Fish Jar
80000075.Desc: Grants 50% Basic Attack DMG Bonus to all Resonators in the team for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000075.Bg:
A Royan specialty strictly banned from Startorch Academy. Salted fish is packed into a jar and sealed with wet clay, allowing it to ferment and develop a strong, distinctive flavor. To eat it, one must crack the jar's lid.

Before eating it, make sure to keep these things in mind:
1. Always open the jar outdoors, in a wide and downwind spot.
2. Never open it indoors, in a warm place, upwind, or near a crowd.
3. Check the jar before eating. If you see a crack, put it down immediately and bolt.

80000076.Name: "Munchie-More" Bun
80000076.Desc: Increases ATK by 10% and Crit. DMG by 20% for all Resonators in the team for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000076.Bg: A Startorch Academy cafeteria classic. It looks like a simple carb-on-carb combo, but it's surprisingly addictive: a soft bun brushed with salad dressing, stuffed with sweet-and-savory fried noodles, topped with red pickled ginger for balance. Most people can't stop munching more.

80000077.Name: Complete Nutrition Squeezy Jelly
80000077.Desc: Increases Max HP of all Resonators in the team by 20% for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000077.Bg: Created for Startorch Academy's students and staff, this jelly is packed with balanced nutrients and fiber, offering steady energy and long-lasting fullness. Its nozzle is designed for easy use anywhere. You can customize the flavor, but be cautious when accepting homemade jelly from others. Not every creative flavor is pleasant for your tummy.

80000078.Name: Lahai-Roi Special Plant Milk
80000078.Desc: Increases Max HP of all Resonators in the team by 1000 for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000078.Bg: A drink rich in nervonic acid that helps sharpen mental response. It's mellow with a hint of pine-leaf bitterness. Developed by the Academy kitchen using local Lahai-Roi ingredients, it represents their effort to explore new, sustainable food options.

80000079.Name: Canned Surprise
80000079.Desc: Grants 50% Resonance Skill DMG Bonus to all Resonators in the team for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000079.Bg: Cake, jam, and cream are stacked in tidy layers, then sealed inside a tin. The metal casing gives this delicate dessert a long shelf life and sturdy protection. Whether you're alone in a dorm room, working late in a lab, or out on a frozen plain, it's always there when you need a small, almost magical comfort.

80000080.Name: Instant Wakeup Energy Gel Sachet
80000080.Desc: Increases Energy Regen of all Resonators in the team by 25% for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000080.Bg: Created for people who dislike sweets, this smooth, savory blend goes down easily and is gentle on the stomach. According to one student who prefers not to be named, it tastes almost exactly like a cat treat.

80000081.Name: Midnight Wonder Cup Noodles
80000081.Desc: Increases DEF by 10% and Max HP by 20% for all Resonators in the team, lasting for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000081.Bg:
Specially made by the Agronomy Wing, the cup noodles are famous for their rich aroma, which somehow manages to tempt people mostly at night. They may not be the most balanced meal, but they're undeniably one of the Academy's favorites.

The container has its own heating system, so just add drinking water and wait. If left too long and the noodles or the vegetables start multiplying unusually fast, please contact the Agronomy Wing for collection.

80010068.Name: Skelecanth Tartare Recipe
80010068.Desc: Used to learn how to cook Skelecanth Tartare.
80010068.Bg: A recipe that details how to cook Skelecanth Tartare.

80010069.Name: Lichen Salad Recipe
80010069.Desc: Used to learn how to cook Lichen Salad.

50000210.Bg: Bio samples collected by the Black Shores' Bloombearers during their fieldwork, which were later transplanted, preserved, and archived in the Bank of Life at Tethys' Deep. When necessary, specimens stored within may be used as supplies and freely accessed by personnel in need.

71500066.Name: Reveler Captain's Seal
71500066.Desc:
Amplifies all Attribute DMG by 25%.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71500066.Bg: Evil sank their ship, trying to stifle their joy. Instead, they turned their last moments into a fiery celebration, singing and dancing atop the blazing sea.

71500067.Name: Falling Star that Tears Fate Apart
71500067.Desc:
The Burning Waves state becomes permanent. While in Burning Waves, Resonators deal 50% more DMG.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71500067.Bg: Only when the stargazer saw destruction fall with their own eyes did they realize that nothing lasts forever. Not even stars that seem to shine with endless life.

71500068.Name: The Clock of Doomed Future
71500068.Desc:
Dealing Tune Rupture DMG to the target increases the ATK and Crit. DMG of all Resonators in the team by 30% for 15s.
All Resonators in the team have their Off-Tune Buildup Rate increased by 100%. Enemies are spawned with Tune Rupture - Shifting for 25s.
Dealing Tune Break DMG increases All-Attribute DMG of all Resonators in the team by 50% for 30s.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71500068.Bg: Like clocks and falling sand, it foretells the doom already ordained. Yet even as that fate draws near, it extends a gentle reprieve—an opportunity not to change the destined finale, but to show the stubborn dignity that defines humanity.

71500069.Name: Gaze that Drowns in Dream
71500069.Desc:
Grants 20% Electro DMG Bonus and 20% Aero DMG Bonus.
When the active Resonator gains a Shield, they additionally recover Ember, triggered up to 1 time per second.
When the active Resonator deals damage while in the Burning Waves state, they unleash an AoE attack, dealing Electro DMG equal to 2400% of their ATK in total, triggered once every 6 seconds.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71500069.Bg: The captain lowered his telescope, certain he had found the fabled land where treasures litter the ground like dust. He barked orders to charge through the last veil of fog that stood between them and their dream. But the fate waiting ahead was something he never anticipated.

80000082.Name: "Sweetness At the Corner" Chocolate Box
80000082.Desc: Increases Max HP of all Resonators in the team by 30% for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000082.Bg: A chocolate box filled with sweetness, and with the bright smiles of your friends melted into every piece. Share this moment of joy together, and let each bite bring back those happy encounters waiting just around the corner.

80000083.Name: Crispy Juicy Fried Pork Chops Lunchbox
80000083.Desc: Increases ATK of all Resonators in the team by 30% for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80000083.Bg: A generously packed lunchbox loaded with flavor. Take a firm bite of the golden, crispy pork chops and savor every last piece. The satisfaction and energy it offers will fuel your next victory!

70290004.Desc: Knowledge the Shaper gleaned from the Heliogyre, enabling you to establish a link with the Solisylum.
70290004.Bg: With your authorization, the Shaper harnesses the full computational strength of the Heliodic Six. Through the luminous stream of data, he perceives the whole truth of Lahai-Roi.

"To freedom. To civilization. To new beginnings."

80001079.Name: Canned Efficiency
80001079.Desc: Grants 55% Resonance Skill DMG Bonus to all Resonators in the team for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80001079.Bg: A dish Mornye invented back when she was a student in her cooking class. She skipped the decorative fruit topping and packed in extra Dusk Honeypots instead, making each bite far more calorie-dense. According to her classmates, in the name of "better nutrition," she even tried adding fish and soggy Fern Spores...

80001081.Name: Rainbow Wonder Cup Noodles
80001081.Desc: Increases DEF by 12% and Max HP by 25% for all Resonators in the team, lasting for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
80001081.Bg: Lynae's custom version of Midnight Wonder Cup Noodles takes her favorite flavor and tweaks it further. For some reason, the steam that rises when it's cooked glows in rainbow colors. One night, after an all-nighter experiment, a student opened a cup in the lab, and colorful mist drifted up from a dim corner, making them think they were seeing things.

42100043.Name: Fusion Interference Potion
42100043.Desc: Within 180s, all Resonators in the team deal 40% more Fusion DMG for 10s after dealing damage to enemies under Tune Rupture - Interfered or Tune Strain - Interfered. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.
42100043.Bg: An oral potion formulated by the Resonator Nursing Unit of Startorch Academy. Its core ingredient is synthesized from unique Laihai-Roi materials. Shake well before use to temporarily enhance the Tune Disruption ability of a specified Attribute.

71600004.Name: Photo from Fa the Soliskin I
71600004.Desc: A photo Matthew left for the Soliskin.
71600004.Bg: The red wasteland lay silent, like a seabed after the tide had withdrawn. The wind lingered, echoing endlessly across the surface. If Fa recalls correctly, this was where they first met Matthew. He was holding that strange object in his hands, which, with a single gentle pluck, let sound bloom into the night, bright and tender. It was here that the Soliskin learned how to enjoy music for the first time, and the photo quietly preserved that moment of first encounter.

71600005.Name: Photo from Fa the Soliskin II
71600005.Desc: A photo Matthew left for the Soliskin.
71600005.Bg: Water cascaded down the rock face, scattering into a fine mist that shimmered softly in the air. If Fa recalls correctly, they practiced playing the music here again and again with Matthew. When they finally succeeded, the melody carried them forward like flowing water. The color of "Mi" softened into green, and the photograph retained the memory of wind and water entwined, a light that still trembles gently, like dew on a blade of grass.

71600006.Name: Photo from Fa the Soliskin III
71600006.Desc: A photo Matthew left for the Soliskin.
71600006.Bg: A massive metal ring caught the light, its curves reflecting a warm, muted glow. Beyond it, the plains stood in silence. If Fa recalls correctly, it was here that Matthew taught them to recover the beat with their own steps. The bass drifted like the wind across open ground, rhythm lighting up within the Soliskin themselves. The photo preserves that moment when rhythm was rejoined, a faint tremor lingering in the sunlight.

71600007.Name: Restored "Music Sheet"
71600007.Desc: A "music sheet" marked with the notes restored by the Soliskin.
71600007.Bg: Beginning, climax, finale... red, yellow, and green marks rest quietly in order, forming a complete score. These colors once drifted separately, carried by wind, water, and light. until they return to a single melody. It is a song they completed together. And it remains, even now, a gentle echo that the Soliskin still remember.

70290006.Name: Void Storm Generator
70290006.Desc: A device containing Voidmatter. Can be used to manually induce Void Storms.
70290006.Bg: By storing Voidworm frequency, the device emits Voidmatter within a set radius, generating an artificial Void Storm.

70050072.Name: Huafeng's Vehicle Key
70050072.Desc: A letter found in the underwater ruins near Ashen Dragon's Crypt of Septimont. It holds the final words of its master.
70050072.Bg:
A vehicle key found in a sealed case at the bottom of Sundermere.

The key of Huafeng's very first vehicle. A fine line engraved on its surface reads: "No.1 Biker." It's the key to both his old dream and his present success. Though the vehicle itself is long gone, Huafeng hopes this cheering line will bring you godspeed wherever the track leads.

44010053.Name: Phantom: Zip Zap
44010053.Desc: Unlocks the Phantom Appearance of the corresponding Echo.

10001210.Bg: A Resonator's Forte is composed of countless Wavebands. When these Wavebands form a complete Resonance Chain, the Resonator can unleash their full power.

Tag: Please contact our Customer Service for assistance

36000016.Desc: Used to modify the Mainstat of an unenhanced 5-Star Echo.
36000016.Bg: Used to adjust Echo frequencies to obtain different characteristics.

71500070.Name: Reveler Captain's Seal
71500070.Desc:
Amplifies all Attribute DMG by 25%.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71500070.Bg: Evil sank their ship, trying to stifle their joy. Instead, they turned their last moments into a fiery celebration, singing and dancing atop the blazing sea.

71500071.Name: Blueprint Where Stars Are Etched
71500071.Desc:
Grants 40% Fusion DMG Bonus. Enemies takes 100% more total DMG from Fusion Burst.
Inflicting Fusion Burst on enemies triggers the following effects:
- Additionally restores Ember, triggered up to once per second.
- Additionally inflicts two stacks of Fusion Burst on the target, triggered up to once per 0.5s on each target.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71500071.Bg:
Stars... stars. Like diamond shards strewn across a black veil. The very pulse and heartbeat of the universe at its dawn.
I will touch them. I will... unravel them.

71500072.Name: Frostlands Where Barreness Thrives
71500072.Desc:
Resonators deal 30% more total DMG to enemies in Tunability - Shifting, Tune Rupture - Interfered, or Tune Strain - Interfered.
Resonators have their Off-Tune Buildup Rate increased by 100%, and Tune Break Boost increased by 50.
Dealing Tune Break DMG grants 30% All-Attribute DMG Bonus to all Resonators in the team, plus an additional 40% Spectro DMG Bonus and 40% Fusion DMG Bonus. This effect lasts for 30s.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71500072.Bg:
"Such a cold, silent path... How much longer should we endure?"
"Not much longer. Don't let go of my hand. Spring... is just ahead."

71500073.Name: Falling Star that Tears Fate Apart
71500073.Desc:

71500073.Bg: Only when the stargazer saw destruction fall with their own eyes did they realize that nothing lasts forever. Not even stars that seem to shine with endless life.

71500074.Bg: Evil sank their ship, trying to stifle their joy. Instead, they turned their last moments into a fiery celebration, singing and dancing atop the blazing sea.

71500075.Bg: Lift your torch higher! Higher still! Until your shadow devours the darkness haunting these walls. Until you become the first to rewrite this long night through the sheer weight of your existence.

71500077.Bg:
Stars... stars. Like diamond shards strewn across a black veil. The very pulse and heartbeat of the universe at its dawn.
I will touch them. I will... unravel them.

42601440.Name: Waxweaver Web
42601440.Bg:
Legend has it that the Waxweavers were once Solsworns, cursed for failing their sacred charge.

Day in and day out, they observe the light. Day in and day out, they weave the light. Their spinning begins with the first rays of dawn and concludes at the hour of twilight when the finished web is retrieved. This endless vigil continues, as if they are still desperately striving to fulfill the duty they abandoned, weaving a web of their own atonement.

For this reason, the Roya maintain a solemn, religious reverence and deep pity for the Waxweavers.

When melted, their silk can be applied to wounds to aid healing, or used as a water-resistant coating.

50010007.Name: Broken Tacet Wave
50010007.Desc:
A special item containing a preserved Tacet Return Wave. Open it to receive rewards from the corresponding Tacet Field.
Claimable Rewards: Union EXP, Tuners, a random Echo set from a previously cleared Tacet Field, and Sealed Tubes.
50010007.Bg: A captured fragment of a Tacet Return Wave, as silent as a broken string. Unravel it, and the Tacetite Bloom contained within will awaken in your hand, offering its soundless gift.

50010008.Name: Pact of Neonlight Leap
50010008.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Pact of Neonlight Leap.

2pcs Set: Spectro DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Casting Outro Skill increases the ATK of the incoming Resonator who casts Intro Skill by 15%. Each point of Tune Break Boost the incoming Resonator has additionally increases their ATK by 0.3%, up to 15%. This effect lasts for 15s, or until the Resonator is switched out.

50010009.Name: Halo of Starry Radiance
50010009.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Halo of Starry Radiance.

2pcs Set: Healing Bonus+10%.

5pcs Set: When healing a Resonator in the team, every 1% of Off-Tune Buildup Rate grants a 0.2% ATK increase to all Resonators in the team for 4s, up to 25%. Effects of the same name cannot be stacked.

50010010.Name: Rite of Gilded Revelation
50010010.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Rite of Gilded Revelation

2pcs Set: Spectro DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Dealing Basic Attack DMG increases Spectro DMG by 10% for 5s, stacking up to 3 times. With 3 stacks, casting Resonance Liberation grants 40% Basic Attack DMG Bonus.

50010011.Name: Morphable Echo - Trailblazing Star
50010011.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Trailblazing Star.

2pcs Set: Fusion DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Inflicting Fusion Burst or Tune Rupture - Shifting increases the Resonator's Crit. Rate by 20% and grants 20% Fusion DMG Bonus for 8s.
50010011.Bg: Through the cracks, deep rumbles of distant waves sound...

50020010.Name: Rite of Gilded Revelation
50020010.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Rite of Gilded Revelation

2pcs Set: Spectro DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Dealing Basic Attack DMG increases Spectro DMG by 10% for 5s, stacking up to 3 times. With 3 stacks, casting Resonance Liberation grants 40% Basic Attack DMG Bonus.

50020011.Name: Morphable Echo - Trailblazing Star
50020011.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Trailblazing Star.

2pcs Set: Fusion DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Inflicting Fusion Burst or Tune Rupture - Shifting increases the Resonator's Crit. Rate by 20% and grants 20% Fusion DMG Bonus for 8s.
50020011.Bg: Through the cracks, deep rumbles of distant waves sound...

54003.Name: Custom Livery: Farewell to Yesterday
54003.Desc: Used to unlock the corresponding Echo Aspect set.
54003.Bg:
Once bound by thorns, these wings now break free, soaring into the boundless sea of clouds.
The old laws no longer hold sway, for they will carry you to the farthest skies of freedom.

50010012.Name: Morphable Echo - Chromatic Foam
50010012.Desc:
Open to obtain a random Echo of the following Sonata Effect: Chromatic Foam.

2pcs Set: Fusion DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: When the Resonator inflicts Fusion Burst on the enemies, they gain the following effects: Gain 10 Fusion DMG Bonus for 15s. While this effect is active, casting an Outro Skill grants the incoming Resonator 25% Fusion DMG Bonus for 15s.

50010013.Desc:

2pcs Set: Aero DMG +10%.

5pcs Set: Dealing Echo Skill DMG to enemies increases the Resonator's Echo Skill Crit. Rate by 20%, and grants 15% Aero DMG Bonus for 5s.

71501001.Name: Inscriber - Lone Light in the Long Night
71501001.Desc:
Enemies take 15% more total DMG and 50% more Tune Rupture DMG.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71501001.Bg: The lantern is entombed in frost, as if a piece of history had been buried within. Someone cradled it, sinking into a deep slumber until the first breath of spring.

71501002.Name: Hopebearer - Lone Light in the Long Night
71501002.Desc:
Enemies take 15% more total DMG. Resonators deal 15% more total DMG to enemies in Tune Strain - Interfered or Tune Strain - Shifting.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71501002.Bg: Here, the light has shed its arrogance and taken a new name: hope.

71501003.Name: Fabricator - Lone Light in the Long Night
71501003.Desc:
Enemies take 15% more total DMG. Echo Skill deals 25% more total DMG.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71501003.Bg: The thorns of the wildflowers had encased the glass, and creeping vines traced the curve of her hand. The girl watched for a long time, and finally reached toward the flame beneath the greenery.

71501004.Name: Solacer - Lone Light in the Long Night
71501004.Desc:
Enemies take 15% more total DMG. Inflicting Negative Status on the enemies increases total DMG by 15% for 30s.

This Token can be used up to <color=#fee388>2</color> times in Whimpering Wastes.
71501004.Bg: The night was far too long, so long that even the end of the endless dark was nowhere to be found. Holding tight to the final spark of light in her arms, in her haze, she mistook it for the breaking dawn.
